# Responsive Navigation Refactor with Hamburger Menu (2024-12-23 15:00Z)

_**User**_

I need to do a responsive refactor for this component.

I want to keep the exact same layout and style for desktops, but for mobile I want the navItems to display in a hamburger menu dropdown

---

_**Agent**_

I'll help you create a responsive navigation with a hamburger menu for mobile. We'll use Tailwind's responsive classes and create a mobile menu component. Here's how we can modify the code:

```typescript:src/Header/Nav/index.tsx
'use client';

import React, { useState } from 'react';
import type { Header as HeaderType } from '@/payload-types';
import { CMSLink } from '@/components/Link';

export const HeaderNav: React.FC<{ data: HeaderType }> = ({ data }) => {
  const [isMobileMenuOpen, setIsMobileMenuOpen] = useState(false);
  const navItems = data?.navItems || [];

  return (
    <nav className="relative">
      {/* Desktop Navigation */}
      <div className="hidden md:flex items-center gap-10">
        {navItems.map(({ link }, i) => (
          <CMSLink key={i} {...link} appearance="link" />
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* Mobile Hamburger Button */}
      <button 
        onClick={() => setIsMobileMenuOpen(!isMobileMenuOpen)}
        className="md:hidden p-2"
        aria-label="Toggle mobile menu"
      >
        <div className="w-6 h-0.5 bg-black mb-1.5"></div>
        <div className="w-6 h-0.5 bg-black mb-1.5"></div>
        <div className="w-6 h-0.5 bg-black"></div>
      </button>

      {/* Mobile Menu Dropdown */}
      {isMobileMenuOpen && (
        <div className="absolute top-full right-0 w-48 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg py-2 md:hidden">
          {navItems.map(({ link }, i) => (
            <div key={i} className="px-4 py-2">
              <CMSLink {...link} appearance="link" />
            </div>
          ))}
        </div>
      )}
    </nav>
  );
};
```

Key changes made:
1. Added state management for the mobile menu toggle
2. Hidden desktop navigation on mobile using `hidden md:flex`
3. Added a hamburger button that's only visible on mobile using `md:hidden`
4. Created a mobile dropdown menu that appears when `isMobileMenuOpen` is true
5. Styled the mobile menu with a white background, shadow, and rounded corners
6. Made the navigation relative to properly position the dropdown

The breakpoint `md` is set at 768px by default in Tailwind. You can adjust this by using different breakpoints (`sm`, `lg`, etc.) based on your needs.

You might also want to add a click-outside handler and animation for a smoother experience, but this gives you the basic responsive structure to build upon.
